Reviews.Title: “Hotel Selene review”
Reviews.Author: catrina s Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, centrally-based hotel within walking distance of metro and buses. Good breakfast choice, no evening meal but several restaurants nearbye. Don't go to the one they recommend, expensive. Recommend you seek out Est! Est! Est! in a side street close bye, friendly family-run piazzeria with good food at a reasonable price. A couple of drawbacks - no tea-making facilities in room and with tea at 3 or 4 euros a cup you would be advised to pack a travel kettle and some teabags! Also massive tv but every channel in Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Very centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: SunSL
Reviews.Content: It's so lovely when the advertising matches upto your expectation of a place. It really is only a few minutes walk from the Termini station (which is the main & largest train station) travelling light with wheeled bags helps the trek to the hotel over the cobblestone pavements) It's so central, the Republica metro is only a 3min walk away from the hotel & from there ALL the tourist sites are just a ride away. The hotel itself is comfortable, clean & spacious. After hearing all the horrors of how small european accomodations are, my cousins & I were thrilled with the room we got. Even with 3 relatively well sized suitcases we were comfortable with space to move around. The staff are excelent. Very obliging & helpful. Francesco at the reception gave some great advice that only a local could give & was always courteous & friendly. Thanks TripAdvisor for helping me find it & the wonderful work you do for travellers. Greatly appreciated!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LeTourer
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal location for exploring Rome. It's just a short walk down the street to the large square (Piazza dei Cinquecento) where hop on-hop off buses pull in, and the Rome railway station is located (Roma Termini). Fabulous! Lots of restaurants within easy walking distance, too. The hotel itself is probably a little dated but this didn't deter from our enjoyment. The photos on the websites show a much more luxurious place than what we actually stayed in, so they're either old pics or they've renovated since our trip. We had a family room which was quite large enough for the four of us without bumping elbows. Even so, the beds were comfortable and the staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. Simoné and Lorenzo in the front office recommended restaurants and provided maps and other assitance. A buffet breakfast in the quaint communal dining room was included in our price which was a great start to the day's activities. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base from where to explore Rome !”
Reviews.Author: Karl T
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife just spent a week in Rome and stayed in Hotel Selene. We found the location ideal to explore the eternal city and some surrounding towns (we went to Frascati, Castel Gandolfo & Tivoli) since it is a short walk away from 'Termini', a train,metro and bus station. Also close by are shopping areas such as the cute Monti area and the slightly more 'mainstream' via Nazionale. Also reachable by foot, albeit further than the station, are landmarks such as the Colosseum, Spanish steps and Trevi fountain. Other lovely areas such as Piazza Navona, Campo dei Fiori and the Vatican can be easily be reached by a 10-15 mins bus ride. As for the hotel itself, I agree with most of the points highlighted in other reviews - courteous & helpful staff, varied buffet breakfast (great way to start the day!), clean rooms & bathrooms, TV, safe and free wifi. As pointed out in at least another review, the rooms may appear to be rather drab to those of us not yet attuned to the Roman baroque style! Style apart, the common area of the building calls for some polishing up, though. Implementing other ideas floated around such as a hot water dispenser would be nice too - but all in all it was a pleasant stay and we enjoyed it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Undertraveller
Reviews.Content: Pros. 1. Got upgraded to a superior room with PSP. TV was damn big. 40 inch i believe. But i never played any games. 2. Clean and spacious toilet. 3. Big and comfy beds with fluffy pillows. 4. Buffet breakfast was good. Staff keep replenishing the items. They were quite considerate and extended the bf by 10 minutes and highlighted that breakfast was ending. Food choices was sufficient and i particularly enjoyed the nutella spread and pastries a lot. 5. Lift was convenient. 6. The male counter staff was helpful and shared with us the cheapest method to get to the airport via Terravision at EUR 6 only. But the female staff failed to share this info with other guest but only advised the internal shuttle service at EUR 45. 7. Toiletries all provided and there was even a safe box in the room. 8. Not noisy at all and sound proofing was good. 9. 10 minutes walk to the train station but quite a smooth walk so do not worry. Cons. 1. No hot water boilers for hot drinks at night. Should at least have a hot water dispenser at a central area. 2. Colours of the room looks rather dull and dark. Making the room look quite lifeless. Should change the colours of the room into bright colour with plain white bed sheets and not he brown ones. 3.. Wifi keeps disconnecting for mobile phones but worked well on laptops.

Reviews.Title: “short stay”
Reviews.Author: becky b
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I were only here for 2 nights at the end of our trip. Great location, clean rooms/bathroom. Good selection at breakfast and it was a good span of time 730a-10a for the service. You didn't feel like you had to rush in the morning just to get a bite to eat. Couldn't get our little door card to work a couple times to the main door, but the reception folks were pretty quick about answering our buzz on the intercom and got us in quickly. I would stay again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: threemusketeers68
Reviews.Content: Chose the Selene Hotel after reading such good reviews on it and also the location was a consideration.We certainly were not dissapointed the rooms were very comfortable, warm, well furnished and spotlessly clean loved our marble bathroomalso lovely soft towels changed every day and linen changed every second day the fridge and safe were also a very handy feature. The fine selection at breakfast got you off to a good start for a days sightseeing and the staff were very friendly and made sure the buffet was well stocked the coffee ( even though it was from a machine) was great and the Machiatto hit the spot. All in all a great choice at a good price. Would definitley recommend to friends and stay again. Obviously training is taken very seriously here so rare to find these days. Keep up the good work Hotel Selene we loved it

Reviews.Title: “Could be Excellent if the TV and WiFi were working.”
Reviews.Author: Katherine E
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that we had the most helpful experience at checkin after leaving our original hotel reservation because of the bad location and service. The room and service were excellent and I would highly recommend this hotel if the television and internet service had been working. Unfortunately, we had moved hotels to be in a better location with internet service. We were very disappointed when we were arrived to our beautiful room on Saturday evening and neither the television or internet were working and would not be fixed until after our check-out on Monday morning. We could have lived without the television but were hoping to look up online locations of recommendations that were given to us. Otherwise, I would have given this hotel an excellent rating because the room and service were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service for the price”
Reviews.Author: standish77
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with Hotel Selene. We chose this hotel after extensive research on the internet and felt that the location and price was great. We were also impressed by the fact that the manager constantly checked and responded to reviews on Tripadvisor and genuinely seemed to be interested in getting everything right for the customer. Our research paid off! Hotel Selene is a great 3-star hotel and I'd come back for sure. The hotel is located only a few minutes walk from either Termini or Republica stations. If you're coming by bus from the airport I recommend taking the excellent Sit Bus which stops only about 5 mins away from the hotel. The reception is indeed based in a small office to the right of the entrance and all the staff there seemed very pleasant and accommodating. The rooms are located above on the top few floors of the building with the breakfast room on the 3rd floor. Our room was a comfortable triple room right on the 4th floor. The interior was tastefully decorated with fabric coated walls and rich blue carpet. There was a mini-bar with quite average prices (€2 for a can of Coke) but no tea or coffee making facilities (we knew about this before hand and brought along a travel kettle which was fine). The en-suite bathroom was clean and had a hair-dryer. There was also a flat screen TV with many channels (though none in English - strange as there was a photo of BBC World News on the hotel's website). If there is one small complaint - the walls between rooms are very thin as sound travelled through them very easily. For the first two nights I was kept awake until 1am by some noisy Americans in the room next door. I complained about this to the reception and it was dealt with swiftly. Breakfast is served everyday from 7.30am till 10.00am in the breakfast room. The room looks much nicer in reality than it did on the website photos. Whilst not a full-English breakfast, the buffet is decent (especially for Rome) with a choice of sweet pastries, croissants, ham, cheese, salami, bread, yoghurt, fruit salad and boiled eggs (even with a choice of runny or hard). The best thing about breakfast was the sandwich maker - so you could have delicious hot toasted sandwiches in no time at all. The breakfast gave us enough energy for the whole day (and with all the many sights in Rome...you do need a lot of energy). Thanks to reading previous reviews on Tripadvisor, I was aware of the fact that the hotel has a restaurant (COTTA) nearby. It was only through Tripadvisor that I knew that if you are a guest of the hotel you can get a whopping 20% off your bill in COTTA as well as a complimentary glass of sparkling wine. I even asked the hotel receptionist if he could recommend any local restaurants and he did mention COTTA but never mentioned the discount. Needless to say I still showed my key card to the waiter and gave my room number...and managed to get the discount. It's a good restaurant and literally only a few minutes walk away from the hotel. All in all, Hotel Selene was a great experience and I wholly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and location”
Reviews.Author: giusie9
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night that it started snowing in Rome!! Had so much fun taking photos of the snow covered Piazza della Repubblica which is just around the corner. Lovely hotel, large rooms, clean and good breakfast. Must admit the entrance could worry you at first glance!! but once inside the rooms are lovely and spacious and nicely decorated. The hotel reception is based in a small office next door to the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: USAlady39588
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Hotel Selene, both times a great stay. Large clean nice rooms, great breakfast room, GREAT location (2 blocks from train station), great price, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Solo Travler”
Reviews.Author: Nlingenfel
Reviews.Content: Value for money, excellent. Great location, very nice breakfast and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: T C
Reviews.Content: Good location, great breakfast, nice rooms but there were a few spots on the wall that weren't nice, clean bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “SELENE-Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Robydr
Reviews.Content: Very pleased from our 4 night stay on a triple room - november 2011 3 minutes walk to 2 differnet Metro stations. Very good breakfast. Nice and clean room and fully equipped bathroom. Excellent hotel staff helped us with getting back our forgotten cellular phone highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: AquastarDanube
Reviews.Content: I will try, in few sentences, to write all things We noticed in order to help future guests and also the general manager. Notice, this is not a classic hotel, more apartment style. First the good things: We stayed 2 nights in room 304 at new part of the hotel ( street away from recepcion desk and old part of the hotel ), room was completely interesting, very clean. Toilet is fantastic ( not bathroom, as shower is beside bed... ) Restaurant beside entrance has nice ambient and good food. Hotel has great location, few meters from Piazza Republica and Via Nazionale. It takes 10-15 mins walk to Historical parts ( Colosseo, Roman Forum, Traian monuments... ) and Fontana di trevi. For my girlfriend it was great as Via Nazionale is full of shops. Very near is also Termini station - great way to come from and to airport. Subway You have at Piazza Republica... Yea, stuff is friendly. Things that can be better: We reserved at booking.com superior room, it says: Room size - 30 square meters. This room was not over 20... My opinion is that it would be a lot better that shower is the part of bathroom as We had to put towels outside the shower doors as wather was leaking under the door. Reception desk is behind doors where is written "Hotel Selene shop"? You have great sign SHS, make it visible! On both places! Breakfast is... good, but small. Just a bit wider range of meals. And, restaurant in Via Nazionale has some strange pictures... I gave rating 4, as I realy had a good stay, and I can recomend this hotel for few days shoping and sighting visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Maria B
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Rome for 4 nights. Hotel was better than expected. Good price, great location, clean and even though our room was facing the main road we couldn't hear a thing. Breakfast was good and the staff was VERY helpful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, good value”
Reviews.Author: 471A_S
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel, close enough to Termini station for benefitting from both metro lines, far enough to avoid the issues related to the station area. No lobby, nor additional services, just rooms and breakfast room. Average rooms, average breakfast, average bathroom. As clean as a hotel with moquette can be.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but ...”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in September-October. In almost every respect the hotel met our requirements. We had a medical emergency in our party, and the staff was both extremely helpful and accommodating. I have only three (very few for me) complaints. 1. The toilet paper dispenser provided one sheet at a time. Seriously. I cannot imagine who designed this or what they could have intended to accomplish. 2. I could not get the e-mail client on my Windows laptop to work. I have never had this problem at any other hotel. I complained at reception. The lady said that she would send someone to look into it, but nothing was done. To be clear, people who used web-based e-mail did not have this problem. I suspect that the ISP did not open the POP3 and SMTP ports. 3. We asked reception to order us a cab to take us to a hotel in Trastevere. We did not get a cab; we got a driving service, and the driver grossly overcharged us because he thought that we were going to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Klára V
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Selene very much. Our room was very clean with perfect cleaning service every day. Hotel staff was extremely helpful (except of one lady at reception). Hotel has an excellent location. It was quiet at night. I would definitely recommend it to anyone - great place to stay in Rome!.

Reviews.Title: “The good with the bad”
Reviews.Author: Erin P
Reviews.Content: So, after reading so many great reviews of this place, I had to stay here. However, I was disappointed other ta commenters failed to mention some very key downfalls of this hotel. Firstly, we arrived at hotel reception and were briskly taken across the street to an unamed building with literally no markings related to Selene. Receptionist didn't explain what the process was but I assume these apartment were the deluxe. It has to be said, they are great rooms, brand new, fantastic bathroom. Problems; -no wifi -no English tv out of 100+ channels!!! -street noise quite loud -rooms very hot. Air conditioner was set to 19 degrees and failed to cool the rooms over 3 nights. Our door key broke and we had to resolve with reception, this is the annoying thing about staying a street away from hotel reception. There were no phone numbers for reception and absolutley no info in the rooms regarding the hotel (ie check out times, breakfast times etc) lastly, having no details on breakfast, we felt confused about the process. We figured out it's at the reception only to have it full with no tables and no plates to eat either. We ended up skipping breakfast every day. I'm so confused by other comments raving about breakfast, it was worst continental in all of Europe ( trust me, I've been travelling in Europe for a while now) despite negative comments, I think the hotel could solve all of them very easy to make for a better stay. Location is the best place around though, we literally walked everywhere! No public transport required. A real bonus. I recommend staying here but I think you should know the process so you ask the right questions and aren't taken shock when you are staying across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Diane S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Selene for five nights in September. It was SO hot in Rome there, that the room offered a pleasant respite. We were were appreciative of the staff's assistance with directions, assistance with a lost credit card...found, thank goodness, suggestions for dinner nearby, ice for my swollen knee!, and calling a taxi for us to get to the airport on the only rainy day we had. The location was so convenient, beting close to Termini and Metro.. Our room was very nice, and the breakfasts were some of the best we had in Italy. Slippery bathroom floors in hotels all over Italy made me nervous...this one too, but I was careful, and that's not really a complaint.

Reviews.Title: “hotel/apartment excellent”
Reviews.Author: brendan m
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nights in their new apartment/hotel.the apartment was excellent,clean,modern and very comfortable.i would highly recommend.location was good.their is a restaurant next door to this new apartment with a 10% discount for residences and the food is excellent best we had in rome.convenient to termini,train and buses.staff were friendly and breakfast was good.only problem i had was with tv,no english channels.9/10

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: KarenK26
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hotel Selene - had booked and paid for room in advance. We arrived from train to be told that we were being placed around the corner in another hotel in a "luxury room". I objected, as I have serious medical issues that make it difficult to walk the distance back in the morning for the included breakfast, but was told there were no rooms. We struggled to keep up, with luggage, as a staffer briskly marched us around the corner to a bizarrely modern room. This building needed a special key to enter after eight o'clock, and only one was available for the two of us, which posed another difficulty. The room had a huge shower encased in frosted glass, rendering the showering person's silhouette visible to anyone in the room. The biggest issue is that the shower door leaked badly, causing a flood into the room after use. Housekeeping was aware of this issue and provided extra towels to mop up and push against the door. On the plus side, the room was clean, the staff in this building was far more pleasant and helpful than at Hotel Selene, and if we had not stayed here, we likely would not have eaten next door at Cotto, where we had two wonderful meals.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Hotel Selene, Rome”
Reviews.Author: TedDobie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at both locations on two separate occasions this past month. The "old" hotel has nice clean, spacious rooms which was nicely air conditioned ( stil hot in Rome) and a lovely marbled and modern bathroom. It was very quiet and the breakfast buffet met all our needs. The location was great, just 5 minutes from the train station. The staff were very accommodating. My only suggestion is to improve the WiFi coverage in the rooms although we had no problem in the breakfast room. On the second occasion we stayed in the newly renovated, ultra modern hotel. The decor was described as minimal and it was, but still very nice. Only comment was it is on a very noisy street and the large doors to the balcony don't screen out much of the noise. Bottom line....we would not hesitate to stay at Hotel Selene or to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Convenient Choice”
Reviews.Author: Sherry B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the staff very accommodating, The room was clean, comfortable, generous breakfast and convenient location to Termini Train, subway and walking to major spots in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in hotel selene”
Reviews.Author: ElinaLiikka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. We enjoyed our stay very much (we were on the new "side" of the hotel). Rooms were big and bathroom was great, although we wondered when we had 2 rooms for the same price, but the other one was a lot smaller and had a shower next to bed?!? The rooms were supposed to be superior, ok the other one maybe was something quite near superior, but the other one didn't quite reach the "superior" status. Location was quite good, near via nazionale. But it was a bit funny that we had to first walk a block to have the "buffet" breakfast and there was no information in the rooms about the facilities of the hotel or the time of breakfast etc. Also the breakfast was below average, nothing warm than coffee and tea. Also something was finished all the time and customers had to wait quite a while to get a refill of something. It was quite boring to eat the same bread,ham and cheese every morning :( Staff was friendly and helpful and a big plus of the airport transportation. We had it on both ways and the ride was very enjoyable! Overall the stay was good and I could stay again in hotel selene.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice! Highly accessible, great comfort and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: arethusas
Reviews.Content: Title said it all. O yes, big buffet breakfast too! But, pls note, the internet/ wi-fi was not working when we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Roma Termani”
Reviews.Author: Kiky T
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at Hotel Selene and i was quite happy with the location of the hotel and the room. I couldnt check in till 2pm but i was able to drop my luggage off and walk around. The front desk lady was friendly and helpful! Great shower as thats the first thing you want when you land and they have free hand soap and body wash dispensers on the wall. My bathroom was the size of my bedroom! The toilet i have to say was huge haha you will know what i mean when you see it! The bed was a bit hard and the pillows were a bit flat though so that could be upgraded.. I thought the breakfast was nice! Handy hint is you can order espresso shots by asking the waiter.. they also have a coffee machine. Not a fancy hotel but i felt it did the job!

Reviews.Title: “nice clean room convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Matt98030
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June for 4 nights as part of a tour. Convenient location, near a main bus train station. small grocery store only about a block away, lots of shops and restaurants. I walked to the colesseum, the Forum, Trevi Fountain; its kind of a long walk but doable. The hotel has only a tiny lobby with nothing but a front desk/counter on the street level. The hotel rooms occupy only 2 or 3 floors of the building, the other floors are occupied by different hotels. My room was very clean, and everything worked fine. The breakfast was very nice, good selection.

Reviews.Title: “Location was the only thing going for it.”
Reviews.Author: mdw50
Reviews.Content: The room was quiet and cool during a heat wave they had in Rome during our stay. We had to watch the staff tho as they would turn off the air conditioner during the day. Also, we had a staff member just use their key to enter our room without knocking while we were relaxing watching television one afternoon. Speaking of television, many many channels but not one English speaking channel. Several of the smaller towns we had staying in during our tour at least had BBC or CNN. Tho the wall coverings were probably nice in their day (lightly padded fabric) they were stained and shabby looking in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: skimoore
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the Hotel Selene, and I enjoyed how well located the hotel was. The room was very spacious, but in a bit of a sorry state, including holes in the walls. The holder for the shower head was broken, and the large bed was two twin mattresses (not great mattresses) pushed together. I had a decent stay, but the room needed an upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and nice service !!”
Reviews.Author: Charles L
Reviews.Content: Its a nice Place to stay with - Nearby the Station Termini and Subway. Reception is nice and helpful. Room is clean and big enough.

Reviews.Title: “ViaRoma”
Reviews.Author: Dennis10_51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a 4 night stay and were completely satisfied with our lodging. By European standards the room was large and the bathroom was nice. We found the hotel staff friendly, helpful, and professional. The maid staff also did a great job in cleaning the bathroom and the room was serviced every day. Combine the quality of the hotel with location and value, I would definitely recommend this hotel. Only downside ( and it is minor) was no CNN, Bloomberg, or other English news channel on the TV. For American visitors, just remember this is Europe, not the US. Go with the flow and enjoy the environment.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: esterffi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a double room with twin beds. Good hotel: The hotel is situated in the 3rd floor of a bit old building. However, the hotel's floor is very new and clean. The room was nice, quiet and big. The breakfast was not very variated, but still not bad. The receptionists were extremely helpful and professional, providing instructions to get to the city's main atractions. Safe area. Good location: Ten minutes walking to Termini, 5 to Santa Mario la Maggiore, and 15-20 to Coliseo. To go to the rest of places I took the bus, which stops very close to the hotel. To summarize, it is not cheap (I paid 134€ per night), but I am happy with it. If I visit rome again, my first option would be looking for something in the Fontana de Trevi's area. If I couldn't find anything affordable, I would go for the Selene hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: nilloc68
Reviews.Content: 10 minutes walk from Termini, very convenient. Only the hotel is next door to its "lobby", if you call that as "lobby" at all. But the receptionist is very friendly and helpful. The hotel lift can only take 2 persons with 2 luggages. A little confusing when we got to the 3rd floor and find the entrance to the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “For the money, this was one of the best hotels we stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Stoutredtree
Reviews.Content: The hotel Selene was a great value. I was very impressed with the staff. They were always helpful and efficient. One, even helped us to get last minute reservations for the Borghese Gallery. The location was great. Close to the train station so it was easy to get there and also to catch the subway to other places. Breakfast was pretty typical but not bad. I would definitely stay at the hotel Selene again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: karephil_1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is so close to everything. It is within walking distance of Termini. and all major sights (except vatican) though you must enjoy walking. Bathroom was clean and a good size. Breakfast was adequate and although not what we North Americans are used to, you can defintely find enough to satisfy your appetite and not walk away hungry, unless you are picky.Front desk staff were very helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable, clean”
Reviews.Author: MeetaP
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Selene because of the reviews of TA. We were happy with the hotel. The triple room was a generous size and the bathroom was gorgeous. The breakfast in the common room was lovely and filling-- both hot and cold offerings. Our room had a window that overlooked an alley that was quite noisy at some times in the morning when the garbage trucks and delivery trucks were trying to get through. The neighborhood is nice and has several restaurant offerings. Very close to the train/bus station. Helpful frontdesk staff. Have to pay for wifi daily.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: rplhampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was comfortable and in a great location to access Termini station, restaurants and local sights. It was a bit of a mission to actually get to the room as the hotel shared the building with 2 other hotels, but reception staff gave very clear directions. The staff were in general a bit arrogant but still were helpful when asked questions. The room was a little dark but it was still comfortable and the bathroom was small but clean. I would recommend this hotel for a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great "Roman Holiday" at Hotel Selene!”
Reviews.Author: italiamia11
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Hotel Selene and it was great. We chose this hotel after reviewing Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel is a very short walk to the Termini train station. The area seems a little seedy but we did not have any trouble and felt safe. The hotel is not a very busy street so noise at night was not a problem. There are some good restaurants in the area and other amenities. The hotel is close to most of the tourist sites and if necessary, public transit is nearby too. The hotel staff is very welcoming and attentive. Gianpierro, Erica, & Simone were all very accommodating and helpful and they speak English very well. They were made us feel comfortable and answered our questions with a smile. Great service! We started our busy days in Rome with a good breakfast and ended with a good nights sleep. The breakfast was fresh and plentiful with variety; the best breakfast of all our italy travels. The quadruple room we had was comfortable and CLEAN. The bathroom was also very clean and a good size. We were very satisfied with our accommodations. I would highly recommend Hotel Selene, especially to those traveling by train and on a budget. Thank you Hotel Selene for making our stay a great “Roman Holiday”.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rick_bubu
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through recommendations read on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed at all. We had a superior room and it was a good size, comfortable with a big, bright, modern and clean bathroom. The interior décor of the hotel is really quite interesting, tasteful and unique and it is obvious that it has all been put together with careful thought and consideration. However, albeit minor, here are the downsides. The bedroom itself was quite dark and even with lights on, never seemed bright enough. We had a lovely big flat screen TV with lots of channels, but it would have been nice to have one English speaking channel, even if it was just the news! Breakfast is till 10am – on some days we went around 9.30 and you could not get the choice of eggs normally on offer – although the breakfast staff did top up the pastries regularly. The lift is tiny, especially with luggage, but be grateful because many comparable places we looked into in Rome, didn’t have lifts at all! Any downsides are outnumbered by the positives – ALL the staff were friendly and helpful although the ones in the actual hotel did not speak English. The reception staff however speak English very well, are very knowledgeable about the area and were always happy to help. The bedroom is very quiet – which is a real plus for Rome; we had no outside noise at all. Our room was cleaned thoroughly everyday, no shortcuts even though we were long stay guests. The location is very good - only 5 minutes from Termini (useful tip – if you do arrive at Termini, take the exit saying Piazza Cinquecento, not via Giorgio else you will end up pulling your bags up a steep dirty road and it will take you 20 minutes!). Nearby the area is lively with nice restaurants, shops and other conveniences with good transport links to everywhere. We felt very safe and knew we had picked the perfect place for us – good value for money and we would definitely stay here again. A final suggestion – upon checking in, reception gave us a voucher for a nearby restaurant called Cotto and we would strongly suggest that you go and eat there! It is literally a 3 minute walk from Selene, the food is of a superb quality and taste, the service was great and waiters were extremely attentive to my ‘fussy-ness’ – it was our best meal in Rome and the 20% discount is a real bonus!

Reviews.Title: “just great except breakfast”
Reviews.Author: nghngnydn
Reviews.Content: everthing was perfect, cleaning, location, silince except breakfast , it was so poor. you need to change your breakfast menu : )

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_Five_O
Reviews.Content: Located close to the main central train station, it took less than 10 mins to walk. As I was travelling from the airport it was ideal.Room was spotless with a large bathroom and the all important room safe. Plenty of selection at breakfast and we found the staff very plesant and helpful. Don't be put of by the lack of recent decoration on the main stairs it does need a major paint job. As the stairs is shared by two hotels it looks like a Mexican stand off is taking place as to who should paint it. Apart from that I would certainly recommend this hotel. City bus tour stop is 3/4 mins away and metro 8/10 mins away. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LarryPatandWally
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasent stay at Hotel Selene in late May. The location was perfect for our sightseeing trips. We walked to the Duomo , the outdoor market, and La Scala but took the subway to the Vatican. Beware the subway! One trip was not too bad however the other was awful. We passed up two trains because they were so crowded people pushed others through the door so they could squeeze in. You might consider a cab!

Reviews.Title: “The Mould attacks!”
Reviews.Author: Halva_11
Reviews.Content: very convenient location. to the subway can be reached within a few minutes to major attractions - for 10-15 minutes. number. First, we were taken not to triple, as we booked online, and in 2 +1 (extra bed), but we have paid triple, respectively, the number is small, with one small window, very dark. Secondly, and most importantly, there is mold everywhere: in the bathroom on the perimeter of the huge windows - black mold in the room - huge stains of mold under the wallpaper. third, very narrow shower: standing under a shower, rested his elbows on the door and the wall, constantly hurt mixer. Fourth, the built-in light bulbs in a closet in the room, the main light in the bathroom did not work. Many photos on this site are not true. Fifth, the Internet they have paid 6 euros for 3 hours, although here's a quote from the site: "Small rooms with free Wi-Fi '. We absolutely do not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location; great value”
Reviews.Author: ajoy61
Reviews.Content: Our party of six was very pleased with our accommodations. We took advantage of the cash discount which made our stay a very good value. Our rooms were clean and quiet. Hotel Selene made arrangements for us to be picked up at the airport, and the front desk personnel were very helpful, calling taxis for us during our stay. The breakfast was very good. Our departure was by train, and the station is only a 10 minute walk away. The only downside was that we had to pull our luggage up the steep marble steps to the elevator landing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in very convenient place”
Reviews.Author: RokasVilnius
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a walking distance to Termini station and even Colloseum. Although selection for breakfast might have been wider and more oriented to local cuisine we would probably select this hotel for stay again next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great price and a comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: jesscisco
Reviews.Content: I stayed in three hotels in Roma, while I was on business in June 2011, and the Selene met my needs: the room was clean and comfortable, the front-desk staff spoke English, the room rates were quite affordable, and the location was a short walk to (or from) the Termini Train Station. My only complaint was with the flexibility of a breakfast-buffet staff member: I had to pick up my wife from the airport and needed to leave the hotel just before 7:00am, when the buffet started. Even though the buffet was mostly set as I was leaving for the train station at 6:45am, the buffet attendant wouldn't let me take a yogurt with me. Needless to say, I was disappointed that I would miss the food, since my trip to pick up my wife would get me back to the hotel after breakfast was already over. But the rest of my stay was pleasant, and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gina1936
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel:here are others that are more attractive and efficient and clean. The check -in personnel were indifferent. Had to go outsude that area into another entrance to go into the hotel and drag your luggage up stairs to an inadeguate elevator, necessitating more trips. The rooms were very dark and dingy. the bedspreads were dirty, the mattresses were thin and dumpy. The third bed was a cot, too close to the floor. All common areas were dirty and in disrepair. In no way did anything look like the pictures on line. The breakfast was good! I invite any one from the management of this hotel to call me or contact me by e-mail. You have my information from the check-in register.. What a way to end what was an incredible trip to Rome. Sad that Hotel Selene was this bad. I will check the site to see if this is posted. Geneva, Toledo

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ferfox
Reviews.Content: Like many places in the ancient Rome, this hotel is in an old apartment building that was converted to some hotels. (I thing Selene shares the building with two other hotels). But anyway, fair prices, a really wonderful breakfast, close to Termini Metro/Train Station and many restaurant options nearby makes Selene an option to be considered. The staff was helpful (we need a taxi to Fiumicino at 5:00 a.m and they were very kind to schedule to us, and for just 45 euros!). I also needed to print my boarding card and they kindly made it. The only issue is that my room had carpets everywhere, on the floor and on the walls, which can be a problem if you have alergies like me. But anyway, I'll comeback for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Left without staying the night!”
Reviews.Author: gmenfl
Reviews.Content: Did Not look like the pictures at all; only the 4th floor was updated; requested superior room but was not available when arrived. Other rooms were dark (decorated in brown), soft beds, and dingy. Go somewhere else, especially for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel! Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Mirtsku
Reviews.Content: Our first stay in Rome, stayed for four nights. The room was quite small. Bathroom was very clean and spacious. Every day the room was cleaned up and towels were changed. Beds were really hard and pillows weren't eiter so comfortable. Didn't hear any noices from outside. Staff was helpful and friendly. Breakfast was ok. Coffee came out of machine and wasn't that good. They had different breads, eggs, juices etc. and we didn't have to leave in the morning feeling hungry! Hotel is near Termini and it is really easy to get from airport (Fiumicino) to Termini and back. All tourist attractions are in walking distance except Vatican. To Vatican we took a two story tourist bus and saw some sceneries at the same time. Near Santa Maria Maggiore was great restaurant, La Vecchia Conca (Via Carlo Alberto, 26 00185 Roma) Would definitely go back to this hotel and definitely will go back to Rome <3

Reviews.Title: “reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Ariadne_TM
Reviews.Content: The staff are grumpy and do not bother to provide information when requested. Difficult access to bags with wheel, it has no ramps, stairs give access only to the hotel lobby. For the other rooms there are only a small elevator. The qiarto is good, I heard noises, but the decor is very old and carpets. The location is good, very close to subway and train station. The breakfast is very basic without many options.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sudesh77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 9-11 June on our first trip to Rome. Hotel Selene is located a few minutes walking distance from Roma Termini, so getting there is a breeze. In fact, most of the attractions are within 15 walking distance to the hotel. Simone (and his staff) were really helpful, and attentive to our queries. We stayed in the new Gamer's Room, and it was lovely - huge TV, clean and neat, awesome bathroom and good sized too. Never got a chance to use the PS3 though since we were busy out! Couldn't find the TV remote in the room, so one of the staff managed to wiggle one later in the night when we got back. Thanks for that! The breakfast was ok, decent spread. Really liked the dining area as it was really homely and cosy. Free wifi was not available when we were there though as it was under repair. So, we took the 3 hr for 5 Euro wifi access card which was not as fast as I would have expected though. Signal drops sometimes but was fine for quick web browsing. Like the previous reviewer said, coffee and tea making facilities would be great. Perhaps in the common dining area where guests can help themselves to coffee/tea and hot water. It was a shame that we only stayed for 2 nights (checked out the last night at 5.30am), but will surely return in the future. Our only disappointment was the booking made with Hotels.com. We booked the room at a higher rate, and when I checked a week later it was cheaper by 30 plus euros. The "price match guarantee" does not work if you pay the price in full. False advertising perhaps since most of the bookings I wanted to do required full payment. Maybe better if you book directly with the hotel, and perhaps you may get a better rate (be nice to Simone ..hehe). Overall enjoyed our holiday in Rome. Will be back for more.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: norms24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel in May, 2011 for 2 nights. The room was okay - with clean towels everyday and the room made up everyday. However, it would have been better if there is a coffee/tea making facility provided. Location of the hotel is perfect for tourists like us as it is quite near the termini and the bus terminal. Very easy to go to the tourist sites and we did not have a hard time going to the airport. And speaking of airport , we would like to make special mention of Allessando and Giampiero at the Reception Desk who were very accommodating when we asked their help re: checking in online at Cathay Pacific. They were quite patient and did not show any impatience nor irritation at our questions. I just wonder about the camera which I noticed was focused at the entrance of the room. I had an uneasy feeling knowing that a camera is there. I wonder.... . . what is the use of the camera and how far does it cover the room?

Reviews.Title: “Worst choice of our trip”
Reviews.Author: Serenedreammm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on 3rd and 4th floors of a run down building near the train station. Paint peeling, floors dusty/dirty. Cameras facing the entry doors was disconcerting! Rooms were dusty and dated and the silkish wallcoverings were stained! Not as described on website at all. Staff were helpful, have to give them props for that!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: rekarp
Reviews.Content: The actual rooms are nowhere near as nice as the website photos. Rooms are small with a tiny tv. The location is great if you want to be near Termini station. There is a stair walkup before the elevator, which is inconvenient. The breakfast is not very good, and I just ate yogurt and a little cereal and avoided the packaged and bad meats and cheeses. Juice was a mix - not fresh or good. Coffee was bad. The hotel is well run and the rooms are clean, but the price is too high for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Paul042011
Reviews.Content: Supurbly located near the Roma Termini. Easy access to the Metro which made touring Rome fun and easy. The full breakfast was especially appreciated. We very much enjoyed our stay and would recommend it very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: amdimi
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be very good, in a great location, with very helpful staff. The General Manager was especially helpful, providing e-m advice prior to our arrival, since our stay coincided with the Pope beatification ceremony. He and his staff also kindly helped with my courier mail, which was forwarded to the hotel for pick up.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great; Bed was very uncomfortable....too hard!”
Reviews.Author: annarn2006
Reviews.Content: The hotel on arrival stored our luggage so we could walk around while our room was made ready., We specifically asked if our luggage would be at the front desk when we returned and they said it would. When we returned it was in the room. We had fragile items we did not want them to move the luggage. The bed was too low to the floor and too hard to sleep on. The front desk people gave us erroneous information on 2 ocassions and could not provide us with a bus map or tell us where we could get one. That made our roma pass useless for bus travel. They did not know the location for the nearby laundry. The location was great with plenty of restaurants and other useful services, but the hotel staff was not helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: susancrow
Reviews.Content: Weve just had four days in this hotel, it was clean, comfortable had good food and ideally placed for sightseeing in Rome. It is just round the corner from the Termini station/bus terminal and where all the hop on, hop off sight seeing tours start from.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect For Our First Visit To Rome. We Will Stay Here Again.”
Reviews.Author: seanandstacyh
Reviews.Content: This is exactly they type of hotel we wanted to stay at. Small, Comfortable, Clean, Convenient, and very friendly. From the moment we arrived, the staff (especially Simone) was extremely friendly and more than willing to assist us with any questions we had. It was a very nice treat to wake up every morning and enjoy the included breakfast (eggs, coffee, espresso, pastries, breakfast meats). The location is perfect for a sight-seer, the Colosseum is a short walk away, the main public transportation hub, Termini, is a 5 minute walk. From there you can get Anywhere in the city with ease (Airport, Vatican City, any of the historic cites). Thank you Hotel Selene and Simone for a great first trip to Roma! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly well situated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DnZWilliams
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Selene after flying in from Gatwick and taking the Leonado Express train from the airport to the main Termini station. From the Termini station Hotel Selene is appoximately a 5 to 10 minute walk. We checked in at the reception and a friendly staff member provided us with useful information and a complimentry Rome tourist guide. The hotel was well situated to a number of the main tourist attractions, we found the Colliseum after about a 10 minute walk and the tour bus pickup point is at the end of the road within a 2 minute walk, the tour bus is highly recommended if you wish to catch all the sights in a short amount of time as they come around every half an hour you can jump on and off as you please to visit whatever is of interest to you. The hotel itself is clean and tidy with a comfortable room with ensuite shower room, tv, wardrobe, minibar, safe and a decent bed. Breakfast is served between 7 and 10am and comprises standard continental fare i.e. ham, cheese, eggs, bread, croissants etc. the dining experience is again clean and cosy and enough food is supplied to cover most appetites until lunch. We enjoyed our stay at the Selene, my only critisism is that there was no free wi-fi (which us smartphone and laptop users are crippled without) for guests and that the first impression of the paint peeling stairwell was not great, once inside the room though we were pleasantly surprised and enjoyed our stay and especially the sights, sounds and history of Rome. As a footnote, you'll need deep pockets as drinks, food and shopping in Rome is pretty expensive!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: tell_subbu
Reviews.Content: My heart sank when the taxi driver dropped us at the entrance. I thought we made big mistake choosing this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised when we entered the room. The room was small (like all hotels that we stayed in Italy); but neat and comfortable. The bath room was clean and we never had trouble with hot shower. The breakfast was good. The location is great - walking distance from train station and bus stand, close to several attractions we wanted to visit, restaurants and a McDonalds nearby. The staff was friendly. WiFi internet available on payment (looks like a standard practice in this class of hotels in Italy). Overall we enjoyed the stay. I will recommend the hotel to anyone looking for value on a visit to Roma. Subbu

Reviews.Title: “More 2 star than 3 but clean”
Reviews.Author: daisy21980
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I chose this hotel for our stay in Rome. Communal areas. The Hotel itself reception is next to the hotel entrance, the reception is small and neat. The entrance next door is very tatty and the paint is peeling off the walls; you don't however stay in the lobby so this was no problem, There is a small lift to the floors. We were on the 3rd floor right next to the breakfast area. The area again was neat and clean. The room. Our room was of a average size and clean. It was very basic. comprising of bed; very comfy. Bedside table, dressing table, small TV, Wardrobe with safe and mirror. There was 1 plug socket. The bathroom had a shower no bath, there was some paint peeling and cracks in the walls but it was clean. There was a hairdryer on the wall and heated towel rail. The shower itself went cold every 20seconds for 10 seconds then resumed to hot for 20 seconds and so on. The view of the opera house was of the car park. Being net t the breakfast area concerned me, but there was no noise, the only noise we heard was from the street and was more than bearable. Staff, All the staff we encountered were polite and accommodating. Position, the hotel is situated in a good position for all areas of the city. Overall I would recommend this hotel but feel it is 2 star and not a 3 due to how basic it is.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient - staff so-so”
Reviews.Author: markiszfamily
Reviews.Content: Hotel Selene is in a very convenient location. The rooms are typical in size for Rome. The room was very clean and they provided American style towels which were great. The maid service was great. The breakfast was very good (with very good coffee/espresso/cappuccino). We travelled with 2 children who really enjoyed it. Alessandro who works the overnight shift was very helpful in coordinating a ride to and from the airport, especially making multiple calls when we encountered a flight delay. They rest of the front desk staff was not helpful. We asked for help making reservations at a gallery and since they didn't call right away (we had to prod them) we could not get a reservation. There are good restaurants in the area. They will try to steer you towards their place (Cotto) but we had great luck with all of the restaurants recommended by Rick Steves.

Reviews.Title: “No Surprises!”
Reviews.Author: slats1273421
Reviews.Content: Originally recommended by RickSteves, this hotel came as advertised. We stayed for 4 nights. It's a middle of the road hotel, conveniently located very close to the Termini Station with a few restaurants and cafes nearby, as well as alementari and other basic needs covered close-by as well. Wireless Internet is available and easy to access for the going-price. I made a Vatican Museaum reservation on the Net, and they printed for me with no questions or issues, which I appreciated. The staff is enthusiastic and helpful. On the downside, it is 3 floors up, but has a lift albeit busy and small. The breakfast is typically Italian-Hotel and not at all inspiring with a coffee/chocolate machine, stale pastries and boxed-cereals, meat and cheese. Room cleaning is consistent and effective...No Surprises!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great stay”
Reviews.Author: USAlady39588
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. I am a single traveler, I was given a large room nicely decorated, clean, and most importantly, quiet. The location was fine, where I wanted to be, and I was able to walk everywhere, this includes the Vatican. Metro buses and subways aren't hard, I just wanted to walk. I found the breakfast great, plenty of choices, nice size breakfast room. My shower (rm 422) water temperature kept changing so I just needed to keep my hand on the dial and move that around as the water went hot/cold/hot/cold. Not a problem, the pluses so outweigh that minor thing!! Thank you to all the staff. Sorry I didn't get to meet Simone. Next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for main attractions.”
Reviews.Author: DevonMitchells
Reviews.Content: Hotel Selene is a lovely hotel in a great location. We found all the members of staff we met to be very friendly, helpful and polite. The breakfast had the usual continental choices including boiled eggs, meat, cheese, yoghurts etc. The coffee from the machine wasn't to our taste but we liked the hot chocolate. We were worried our room might be noisy as it is on a street just around the corner from the train station but it we didn't hear a sound! We found it easy to walk to lots of the main attractions although we did get the metro to the Vatican so we could get there early we did walk back which didn't take very long. There is a very nice restaurant just down the road from the hotel called restaurant strega which did a very good carbonara starter!

Reviews.Title: “They get it!”
Reviews.Author: TonyandSandy
Reviews.Content: 5 min walk from train station. We couldn't have been happier. Hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful. Staff went out of their way to help...even ironed a pair of slacks free. Location was convenient to almost every attraction we wanted to see. What more could you want? Simone Puorto, the manager was super. He understands that the customer comes first and gave us everything we needed. He went the extra mile for us on everything...directions, use of fax and phone, everything. If I had to say anything negative... small slow elevator and non impressive free breakfast...neither is a deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is GREAT! Kudos to Manager Simone Puerto and his GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: Joe_GardenCity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 4 nights and from the moment we checked in to the last day we checked out, we were treated warmly and sincerely by Simone and his staff. We arrived early and the room was not ready. But Erica made sure our luggage was taken cared of by Abril (who is quiet but very serous and diligent) and by the time we came back in the evening, we were warmly greeted by Jun (another staff) and shown to our room. Breakfast offering was abundant and the staff was gracious. Every inquiry we had and every request we made were carefully considered and taken cared of. Hotel could not be any more convenient as it is just a few minutes walk from the Termini (Rome main station). While there are many other hotels in the neighborhood, I venture to say Selene probably offers the best value for any traveler. Kudos to Simone and his Great Staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Selene and Simone Puorto”
Reviews.Author: N092010
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Selene was clean, comfortable, well located and very well priced. And the staff was incredible. Upon booking via the internet, I emailed asking for help finding a relative in Rome since I had an old, out of date address. The staff at the hotel found my relative and emailed back his current address, phone number, work number and email address! Upon arriving at the hotel, Simone Puorto was so incredibly helpful and pleasant and patient. And all of Simone's interactions with us were genuine and sincere. He is a treasure! I would definitely recommend the hotel to everyone and personally stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: EMT5
Reviews.Content: Good beds, nice room, clean, breakfast simple but enough. Location very good: near railway station and near center. Friendly staff at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: lovewine95991
Reviews.Content: Hotel Selene is a good value and central location. The room was small but efficent and the breakfast was a good European type breakfast. As tourist we did not spend much time in our room. If you are looking for luxury this is not for you but if you want good access, safety, cleanliness and a responsive management, this is the hotel for you. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Mamahila
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through inItalia.it and got a very good price. It was difficult to find a hotel that would take 2 adults an 2 teenagers in one room, but hotel Selene offered this. Stayed at the hotel Selene for four nights and it totally filled our needs. We could walk to everything, except the Vatican, but for the Vatican we found a bus just around the corner. The rooms were clean an breakfast was ok, except the coffee from the machine. Have seen some comments about the coffee here, and hotel response said that it was possible to order coffee from staff, but there was no sign of that possibility. Some of the staff was very nice and service minded (male receptionists), but the breakfast personnel (and female receptionist) would definitely had a better day if they tried to be a little more smiling and accommodating. All in all we had a very good stay for the price, and I could stay here again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Ottimo”
Reviews.Author: AdGreg
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful. Great friendly and knowledgeable staff. Rooms were clean and housekeeping was exceptional. Breakfasts were great - large selection of food and drink. Rooms were quiet, comfortable and spacious. Beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A charming , well-located hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Lynneg28
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Selene. It was a few blocks from Termini Station and walking distance to many attractions. We had a twin room with tub and hand-held shower. The beds were narrower than standard and quite firm, but certainly adequate. The air conditioning worked extremely well. Everything was clean and functional. The buffet breakfast was generous, with eggs lovely pastries and a marvelous coffee/beverage machine that provided anything you could want. We loved the cappecino. The staff were both helpful and professional. We would definitely stay at Hotel Selene again.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay, too many problems”
Reviews.Author: johnnybags
Reviews.Content: We were in and out of Rome twice over a four week period, five nights at Hotel Smeraldo at Campo Fiore and two nights at Selene at the tail end of our trip, which we chose for Termini Location, and comparisons became inevitable. For basically the same hotel room, Selene cost 50% more than Smeraldo, the room was not particularly clean, the Internet was out for the first night, the elevator was out the second night, breakfast (which was good) started one half hour later at 7:30 AM (which we gobbled down on morning two to make our plane), and the front desk help was pretty lacking (niether helpful nor apologetic about internet problem, fumbling through papers to find lost contract, no ideas about good local restaurants), making it compare unfavorably. With that, I've been in worse big city hotels, to be sure,and I'll give them some slack that everyone has bad days, so it gets a three.

Reviews.Title: “I made a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Rafalafala
Reviews.Content: I was happy with my stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast very good. It is a bit far from the major sights but as a native New Yorker, I had no problem hopping on and off the metro and buses, and with the 3 day metro ticket I made the most of it. The hotel is just 5 minutes away from either the Termini train station and Metro or the Republica Metro. My only complaint is the shower stall was just a bit bigger than the pods that will be used to evacuate the Chilean minors. Other wise it was a large bathroom. AND, very important for me, the air conditioning worked really well during the 80 degree days we had in the begining of October. Oh Yea, lots of good restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,Clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: alhillScottsdale_az
Reviews.Content: Good location on Via Vimanale right by the Opera House and 5 minutes from the train station. Rooms were clean,breakfast was good and staff was attentive. Not a luxury hotel but not bad . On second floor with recption on the ground floor. Management appears to be aware of guest's comments and replies to each one, which I find very encouraging. Not many hotels have such personalized service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, and close to the Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: gintyb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotele Selene because we wanted to be within walking distance of the Termini station for our trip home and to explore some areas of Rome we hadn't caught at the beginning of our holiday when we stayed near the Vatican. We found the hotel to be conveniently placed, quiet, (our room did not face the street) and with a very nice bathroom.The included breakfast was pretty good. We were able to walk everywhere we needed to go, and also to store our luggage for a few hours on the last day. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and price!”
Reviews.Author: fluidkarma
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Rick Steves' guidebook and it did not disappoint. Located within walking distance of the Termini train station and Metro stop, there are also a number of excellent restaurants and shops nearby on Via Nazionale.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, great location...”
Reviews.Author: Fe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group, traveling as a solo. My room overlooked the main street and a portion of the adjacent square. The weather was nice enough to ventilate the room through the large window. The room was immaculate. The bed comfortable. The bathroom very nice save for the hair dryer hose on which an attempted repair was made with tape...didn't work very well. The location is great to access the metro and train station. I thought the breakfast was very good, except the coffee machine :( . The staff was very helpful in arranging transportation to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: whereisnext
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Selene after reading some of the best reviews for a 3-star hotel in Rome and we have to admit it wasn’t great but it certainly wasn’t bad either. The Selene is a very convenient 5 minute walk from the Termini station which for those that don’t know Rome is the main hub for getting to and from the airport and the main tube station with access to all compass points in Rome. Rome is also a walking city, so you can usually map out extensive routes and have the hotel as your final destination without missing too much. The rooms were nothing spectacular although they were definitely clean, the beds comfortable enough and there was also a free safety-deposit box for when you left. The shower would always go from extremes of hot and cold though which was frustrating. The staff spoke English but (with the exception of the people at reception) weren’t too friendly and we were yelled at for turning up to breakfast at 10:05 when it finished at 10:00am. Breakfast wasn’t spectacular and they relied on an automatic machine to make the coffee which in Europe is somewhat of a crime. I’d definitely recommend it to others as it was clean and safe but it’s certainly not for high-class travelers.

Reviews.Title: “No, no, no !!!! Stay away”
Reviews.Author: SarahJB48
Reviews.Content: We had the misfortune to stay here one night and chose it as it was close to Termini. We may have just been unlucky but our room was so dark and dreary, tiny window and no window at all in the bathroom. You have to lie on the floor to acess the safe. We did not pay top price but have stayed in much nicer hotels for the same price! I have to say it was actually clean but we just found it grim.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Melissa R
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good hotel. It's nothing spectacular, but it's decent and is in a perfect location. It is right near Termini (where you grab the Leonardo Express to the airport). It's right near metro Repubblica as well. The rooms were good. Nice bathroom (with a bidet and a stall shower), comfortable enough beds, and a small TV. There's a safe to put your valuables and passport in. There's no alarm clock on the night table, so I recommend if you need to wake up at certain times for your trip or for the last day to bring a cheap travel clock with you. I tend to do this for my European vacations. Our room was on the third floor. They aren't big flights of stairs, so I recommend that if you're not lugging around luggage for your whole stay, to just use the stairs, as sometimes the elevator can get stuck at a floor or take a while to get to your floor. You can buy an internet card at their front desk for 2 hours, and it isn't a terrible price. You can stop and restart on the card if you're only going to be checking one thing (like to make sure your flight hasn't changed) and resume using the card at another time. The only problem was that I found my hotel room got almost no signal (it went from 2 bars to 0 sometimes), so I'd have to go into the area with the couch to check that information (where I got 4 or 5 bars). Not a big deal though when you're just checking a few things! My favourite part was probably the breakfast. There's bread, cheese, salami, eggs (soft or hard-boiled), juices, cereal, etc. There's also a coffee machine with various options. Though I can never eat much in the mornings, I did try my best to take advantage of this breakfast! ;) I would definitely recommend this hotel as it was good and in a great location. If I were coming back to Rome, I would consider going here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Short Stay at Hotel Selene”
Reviews.Author: Kirk
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, close to the train station and Metro line. Front desk was very helpful at check-in with providing a map of Rome and suggested routes to see the sites. Breakfast was very good with a wide assortment of fruit, pastries etc. Room was very quiet and spacious enough for the two of us with a mini-fridge, in-room safe and very nice marble bathroom. Front desk arranged for a limo at departure to take us to the airport which was pricier but more convenient than taking the train there. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: christyreznor02
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located and in walking distance to the major attractions in Rome. It's close to several restaurants. The rooms are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Selene is just an easy 10 minute...”
Reviews.Author: AmyinAlberta
Reviews.Content: Hotel Selene is just an easy 10 minute walk from Termini Station, which was fine even after 24 hours of airports and planes. The room was very clean and had all the amenities you'd expect for the price. We were there 4 nights, which is too long for Rome in my opinion. We booked on hotels.ca and were told when booking that breakfast would be 7€ per person per day. Nobody charged us. Breakfast was plentiful by Italian standards, boiled eggs, yogurt, fruit salad, cereal and pastries. It was the same every day which got a bit tedious. The hotel is a quick walk to Fontana di Trevi and Piazza di Spagna, and a 6€ cab one way to the Colosseum. The men working the front desk were immensely helpful for tourist info, even printed off the train schedule for our next destination. The neighborhood is very touristy, with overpriced pizzarias every few metres. It's hard to avoid, my suggestion is to stay at Selene, see the sights quickly and then get out of Rome. Buon viaggio!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cavecere
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Good breakfast. 20 minute walk to the Coliseum, Trevi Fountain. We didn't mind walking so this hotel worked for us. We took the subway to get to the Vatican (sign up for the Scavi Tour!). The hotel arranged for a taxi to take us to the Airport (~45 minute drive).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hannah080
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very good location, close to metro and train station within walking distance. No complaints about this hotel, would stay again. Breakfast was very nice, lots of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, despite booking issues”
Reviews.Author: SanMarcosTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Selene was the first hotel we stayed in Italy, during our 5 city vacation there. We arrived at the hotel with them not able to locate our reservation - turned out 1800hotels,com who we used to book the hotel went bankrupt before we arrived there and our reservation was canceled without our knowledge. Lucky for us, they still had a room, so we got to stay there. The con was that we had to pay much higher rate, in Euro cash, than the rate we originally paid to 1800hotels.com. The room was comfortable, A/C was effective and hugely helpful with the 100F+ weather. Staff were helpful to their abilities (not able to discount the price or take credit card for the payment). Location is good, as long as you are willing to walk, we walked everywhere - train station, Coliseum, Spanish Steps, etc... Hotel recommended restaurant was nice. Definitely would stay there again IF I can get a discounted price, and pay with Credit Card.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely come back again!”
Reviews.Author: Missinnocence
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I came to Italy...I didn't know where to stay. The cleanliness is what I care the most when I live in a hotel. I would get crazy if the room is messy. But Selene is perfectly satisfied my need! The staff there are also friendly, especially the mananger. The whole place made me feel like home. I was even kind of sad when I checked out...I will definitely come back again~See you guys next June!

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, friendly staff, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Marcia74
Reviews.Content: My sister and I enjoyed our staye here for 3 nights. After a dilemma with our pre-paid reservation, the staff at Hotel Selene helped my sister book another hotel room for the night. (We then spend the next 3 nights at Hotel Selene.) When I arrived they escorted me over to the other hotel. Simone and Fabricio were very helpful and gracious to us. The room is spacious for two people, with ample closet space. The bathroom was pretty, clean, and large. Houskeeping cleaned our room daily. I was surprised by the nice breakfast that was offered daily. The had meats, cheeses, breads, sweet pastries, boiled eggs, yogurt, cereal, coffee, tea, juices. The elevator is small and sluggish. The winding stairs aren't too bad walking up. The hotel is a brisk 5 minute to Stazione Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: mayrametal
Reviews.Content: The breakfast in this hotel is superb, specially for Italian standards. Everything was included, e.g., different cheeses, salami, yoghurts, different cakes, at least 2 different juices, coffee machine with multiple options, cereals, different bread types. This was definetily the hotel highlight. Staff is ok. Location is really good, very close to the train station and surrounded by restaurants. Rooms were very comfortable and big.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CLC365
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Selene for a week to celebrate our second wedding anniversary. The hotel is conveniently located near the center of Rome and just a short walk from the train station. It was a good base for exploring the city. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the room was small but clean. Breakfast was adequate with boiled eggs, yogurt, fruit, pastries and various meets and cheeses. Coffee came from a machine and was ok. I wasn't thrilled with the beds- the room had twin beds that are situated right next to each other instead of a queen bed like our reservations stated. I would recommend the Selene to couples on a budget and families, but it isn't ideal for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: CatarinaCastanheira
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from pretty much all the main touristic sites. We only took the bus to go to the Vatican. The rooms are ok: confortable and clean but a bit noisy because there are a lot of restaurants in the street. The breakfast could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great.”
Reviews.Author: menovsky
Reviews.Content: Location is great, close to the train, metro and bus route. Room was clean and breakfast was ok

Reviews.Title: “A quiet place to stay by the train station and park your bags.”
Reviews.Author: Gfirst
Reviews.Content: I had the hardest time trying to figure out a place to stay with the prices and areas in Rome. We were only in for two days and I thought if we stayed by the Train station we would have quick access all around. The hotel staff were all very nice. Our room was small, had the only balcony oddly facing the elevator in an alcove. I chose this place because for the price and the reviews I figured we only needed a place to crash at the end of a long day. Although not disappointed with what I set to do, I think I would pay another 50 euros or more to stay closer to the center of town. The bathroom was very nice, almost the size of the bedroom. The bed itself was what I had an issue with, the mattress i could feel the bed springs. the pillows very flat were easily fixed with the addition of another. On the second night I was so exhausted that the springy mattress wasnt really an issue. The breakfast was ok. The cafe is run by an automatic push button so that didn't taste very authentic. But the location was right next to the train station, literally two blocks. We ended up sightseeing and walking so much though that the extra walk back to the train station would have better been saved by staying somewhere like camp o friari (excuse my spelling). To sum it up, great idea to stay here with nice staff, and pleasant room if you really want to be close to the train station. They will also hold your luggage when you check out. For the price paid it was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: maranne
Reviews.Content: Great clean and comfy hotel with good location and great breakfast - thanks Four Aussies Mark Anne Sherri Matt

Reviews.Title: “ticked all the boxes for us”
Reviews.Author: poshmile
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was welcoming and friendly, also very helpful. We had a porter to take our baggage up to our room. The breakfast staff were friendly and worked hard to accomodate everyone. The cleaners were also very pleasant. The room smelled slightly of cigarette smoke initially, which cleared as we left the window open for a while. The room was very clean, soundproof, tastefully decorated. The shower was excellent, lots of water, good force. There is a dispenser in the shower for shower gel and shampoo which saves you struggling with little bottles. The TV worked well, there was plenty of storage, with shelves and a large wardrobe containing an extra pillow, duvet and blankets. The room was quiet and restful. Breakfast was adequate for us as we spent most of our time outdoors. To eat were pastries and cakes, boiled eggs, bread, cheese, ham, fruit salad etc. The coffee was excellent and you can order as much as you like. The location is very convenient, close to the metro, termini station where we could buy our shopping and walking distance to some of the sights. It was easy to find and the Theatre opposite is a great place to spend an evening. There are loads of places to eat near by as well. This hotel was perfect for our holiday. We were on a small budget but received excellent value for money here. It is set in an old building which is at first a bit worrying, but when you get to the hotel on the 3rd and 4th floor, its completely different.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: havenexile
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed here for the recent rugby international. Had 2 rooms which cost 477 Euros for 3 nights. 5 minutes walk from Termini station, about 15 minutes walk from colosseum. Rooms were quite large & clean, as was bathroom. Buffet style breakfast that was OK

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mazzr
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel with a great location close to Termini Station and most of the sights in Rome. Staff could be more helpfull, and don't have too high expectations of breakfast - it's simple but it's there. But all in all good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, recommended”
Reviews.Author: DMRA
