Reviews.Content: 5 of us stayed here following a football match. Is very well situated for the Station and various sites in Rome. The staff were very friendly and the breakfast good. The rooms are quite small, but for our purposes this did not matter. They staff let us leave our bags the day we left as we wern't getting a return flight until the evening. No extra charge. We had a very good "cash only" deal - provided excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: HLstephanie
Reviews.Content: so nice hotel, near station, easy to find. the booklet which given by the hotel is really good! very detail description of the sightseeing place and map with pocket size.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful quiet spot with friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: jeninasheville
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Selene Hotel for two nights. It was a wonderful retreat in the middle of all of the Roman noise. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly, and it was within easy distance of the train station, and easy walking distance to almost all of the sights. The breakfast was good - they had a panini press so my husband was happy! The room was small (by american standards), but nicely decorated and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: NJHoya
Reviews.Content: Hotel is as advertised. Rooms were nice and spacious. Hotel staff was very helpful. About 4 blocks from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel near train station”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaClare
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights here, easy walk from the train station. The beds were hard, pillows were hard, but the service was great!!! Breakfast was good. I would stay here again on a return trip to Rome, great value, as hotels expensive in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Reasonable money.”
Reviews.Author: valkirius
Reviews.Content: One of the best possible locations - you are in walk range to railway station and subway or you can just spend ( as we preferred ) a whole day on waliking and sightiseeing this lovely city. A room was quite modern with nice bathroom. Nice service, usefull maps and paper guides for all guests. The only disdvantage was a terrible, plastic style breakfast ..but - good restaurants are located just opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: janeanne_9
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel - without frills - however the rooms very modern and clean - with super king bed and good bathroom. Excellent location as within walking distance of the metro and buses. Breakfast was buffet style but with friendly waitress. Reception staff very friendly. In fact a good all round hotel - which I would come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: pollitis
Reviews.Content: We found the selene hotel in a small street down the opera plaza, close to the terms of Diocletian. The arrival was quite funny because the building is split in various hotels, with a typical old italian man, sitting in the street in front of the elevator! Once arrived in the hotel, you may then enjoy the accomodation which is one of the best bargains we could get in Roma : cozy room, bathroom with marmor, everything was fine and the location is very convenient. A few restaurants down the streets close by are there for a wonderful evening. We would go back there as soon as we could!

Reviews.Title: “So nice!!”
Reviews.Author: TommyTT69
Reviews.Content: The most impressive aspect of the hotel was the location. It is so well located and Close to so many of the must see sites and one block from the main station. The room was very nice, spotlessly clean, very comfortable bed. tasty breakfast buffet. The hotel was exactly as portrayed on the web site . If you book from HoteSelene web site is cheaper than other and you can get a good 10%. The staff assisted us with restaurants (they got 2 run by the Owner: Cucina nazionale and Cotto) , tours, transfer to FCO airport and even showed us how to phone home with a calling card!!! The mini bar in our room was not loaded with anything but we put inside all our stuff Try the hotel restaurant COTTO we went there for a welcome drink… Terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: JSKAbroad
Reviews.Content: In Rome after a Mediterranean cruise and was seeking a well located hotel to take in as much as possible before heading home. Rome hotels are on the pricier side but the Selene was actually very reasonable. We were traveling with our three year old daughter and were able to book a room with a king size bed, (a REAL one for that matter, not two mattresses pushed together) and a small day bed. The amenities of the hotel are spartan but this is Rome, it's not like you are going to sit around the hotel! A continental breakfast was included that proved to be hearty and was accompanied by sensational coffee. The hotel is a little hard to find although it is walking distance from the main train station, even with luggage. Despite it's center of the city location, the hotel is quiet and the rooms positively perfect for sleeping. All in all, a safe bet for a brief stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: Clemsontiger1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Selene on the last day of our trip to Italy. We chose to spend our last night there because it was close to Termini and we needed to catch an early flight the next morning. While the hotel is close to the train station, we found a lot things lacking. Here were the main issues we encountered: - The TV did not work - There was a rather large hole in the ceiling close to the overhead light fixture - The bedspread was stained - The shower drain clogged - we had water up to our calves as we were taking showers I do want to mention that the staff was pleasant and we had no issues with our reservation. We were not able to try the breakfast becasuse we had to leave for the airport very early. Based on the issues we had, I would not recommed this hotel, with so many others in Rome to choose from,

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: christineGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We paid 135 Euros a night for a double room. The room was modern and nicely furnished. It had a bathroom with a shower which was nice, and had a hairdryer. The room had a TV (with CNN and Eurosports for English speakers), mini fridge and a safe. The bed was comfortable and the furniture nice. The location of the hotel is great. Only a five minute walk from the train station. We walked to all of the sights (about 10 min walk to Trevi fountain, 15 to Colosseum, 30 mins to vatican). The walks in Rome all seem quite short as there is so much to see on the way to anything! The breakfast was nice. A European breakfast with bread, pastries, crereal, boiled eggs, ham, cheese, fruit, yogurt. Couldn't fault the hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfy, good value - no problems!”
Reviews.Author: dennis-n-minnie
Reviews.Content: We selected the Selene for its closeness to Termini transport connections and its reasonable rates. After reading reviews wasnt quite sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised by the overall standard. Initially finding the hotel wasn't too easy as we arrived at night as there is no neon sign, but its only a 5-10 min walk from Termini one block before the Opera House - on the opposite side of the road. As noted in previous reviews, the reception is actually next door to the hotel entrance but that wasnt a problem - it is a proper reception desk, and staffed 24 hours. The staff we met were always very welcoming and helpful. If you dont want to go too far in the evening there are nearby bars and restaurants. The hotel itself is on the 3rd floor, via a lift and secure door - there are steps to the lift which may be a problem if infirm, however there is a helpful and polite porter on hand to help with bags and show you how the doors work. We had a twin room at the front of the hotel and the furnishings were old but clean. The room was quite large with adequate wardrobe space, the beds were comfortable and the walls were sound-proofed ensuring it was quiet. There was a tv and free safe in the room. The bathroom was good size and very clean. Breakfast area was basic but again very clean and a plentiful buffet of cereals, juices, yoghurts, meats, cheese, rolls, pastries etc. Hot drinks are brought to order. Have to say the regular coffee was pretty bad, but the cappuccino and tea were fine and the hot chocolates served at another table looked very tempting. We had a early flight on our last day and the reception staff offered to organise a packed breakfast bag for us to take with us - croissants, juice, yoghurt ect - which kept us going after an early start. We got a special winter offer rate - offers are on their website - and werent expecting too much but it was very good value for money and a decent standard of room in a very convenient location. Will certainly consider the Selene again when returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: EC2006
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what I expected of a hotel in Rome. Not the most stylish but met all our needs perfectly. It's in a great location just down from Termini station and also just off Via di Nationale which is a lovely street to walk and have bit to eat. The reception area is funny as it's not in the hotel and I didn't find the reception staff too friendly. The porter who took our bags up was very nice. The room was a good size, very clean, small bathroom but a good shower. The bed linen was changed every day and fresh towels left in every day also. The breakfast was good, you got a buffet that met all needs from coffee/tea to toast to cereal to fruit and yoghurt. The lay out of the hotel is a bit funny you enter off the street and climb about 2 x 5 steps up to the lift. You go up 3 stories and you come to a door that looks like a fire escape, you need your room card to get inside this door. Then you walk through the dining room to get to the bedrooms which I thought a little odd but the building had 3 hotels in it so hence the 3rd floor was hotel selene. For the price and location I would recommend it and would definetly go back again

Reviews.Title: “Good money value”
Reviews.Author: gabip
Reviews.Content: Overall, I had an wonderful experience. Although the builiding is old (after all, is Rome :-)), the room was clean and quiet (10x to the wall sound proofing) and surprisingly big. Breakfast was ok (not rich, but satiable) and the stuff was more than pleasant. The hotel is close to Termini and the area is safe, so.. Yes, I would stay again at Selene.

Reviews.Title: “good location and value”
Reviews.Author: PNWmom
Reviews.Content: Our family of three spent three nights at this hotel. The location was good and close to a metro station. Easy walk to Trevi and Spanish steps, and also close to some of the larger churches. The room was nice and clean. The bathroom was very nice and large by US standards. Beds were very firm and not much padding, but we found this to be the standard in other Italian hotels we stayed at. Air conditioning worked really well, and we were glad for that in August. The room rate (triple) was reasonable for the area and we would stay there again. We booked with them directly via email, and then faxed our information to them. They were prompt with replying to our email reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: retiredandtraveling
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and would recommend to anyone who wants a clean, quiet hotel. No lobby or fancy bar, just a helpful, pleasant staff, good beds, clean bathroom and very good breakfast. We walked to the center of town everyday, although the trip coming back seemed long after walking the sights all day! Several good restaurants in close proximity - we really enjoyed Est! Est! around the corner. We booked several months ahead and the price was certainly right.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice When Staying In Rome”
Reviews.Author: KahunnaTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights in mid-March, 2007. I chose the hotel based on its location (near Termini), the large number of positive reviews it had received from other reviewers, and price (89 euro/night double occupancy). The hotel is located to the west of Termini on the left side of via Viminale. About a 15 minute walk from the train station pulling a bag, the hotel is also about a 15 minute walk south from the metro station at Piazza d Repubblica. The Selene Hotel is located in the same building with two other hotels (one now closed as of this writing), some offices, and some private apartments. All share the same common building entrance (which can be confusing for the first time guest). The reception and business office for the Selene Hotel is located in a separate space on via Viminale immediately to the right of the common entrance. The hotel office is manned and open around the clock, the staff spoke fluent English, and were very helpful when asked for assistance. In addition to booking the normal tourist tours, the hotel office can also book a private car to either of Rome's two airports at a very reasonable 45 euro for up to a party of 4. This is very helpful when you have an early morning flight, and need to be at the airport before the trains are running. Access to your room is either via the stairs (about 5 flights), or a micro-sized elevator. Most, if not all, of the hotel's rooms are located on the 4th floor of the building - as is the breakfast room. The guest rooms are of average size for Rome. Walls are padded to provide sound proofing. Pictures attached to other reviews fairly, and accurately, portray both bathroom and bedroom layouts and decor. Beds are very firm and closet space is limited. If traffic noise bothers your sleep, ask for a room that does not front via Viminale. Room TV's carry programming in Italian, German, and English (Sky Sports, and CNN International). Rooms also have a small refrigerator and a safe. Breakfast is served between 7:30 AM and 10:00AM, and consists of the standard fare - cheese, ham, hard rolls, soft eggs, croissants, bread/toast, yogurt, granola, milk, juice, and coffee with biscotti. Selection and availability of rolls, yogurt, and croissants are better earlier in the breakfast service than later. The neighborhood has a fair number of restaurants. Two of note are La Cucina Nazionale, and Pizzeria Ricci. La Cucina Nazionale is located about 10 minutes north of the hotel past the Opera and near the Piazza d Repubblica. Hotel guests are given a 10% discount on their bill. About 15 minutes to the west of the hotel is the Pizzeria Ricci. Reputed to be the oldest and best pizza place in Rome (per Lonely Planet), it's a wonderful place to dine. For those who like to get salami, cheese, sandwiches, and water/soda for picnic lunches in the piazzas, there are also 2 supermarkets in the vicinity. One is about 150 meters west of the hotel further down via Viminale. The other is located about 150 meters east of Termini in the Piazza d Independenza, and has a bigger selection of items. Overall, the Selene Hotel offers very good location, value, and service. I can recommend this hotel, and will stay here again when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Ireland_member
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills hotel, offering excellent value. One minute's walk from the Opera; very close to the Metro. There are no public area facilities such as lounge, bar, etc - but with Rome on your doorstep, who needs these! The rooms are perfectly adequate, if dimly lit (bring your own light bulb if you want to work or read).Bathrooms spotless. Quite good buffet breakfast; superb coffee, very pleasant service. A word of caution: two of our party were accosted by very determined pickpockets outside the hotel. As there is no supervised reception area, one can feel a little exposed going in. Also, avoid the cafe immediately next door: we experienced overcharging and very pushy staff.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Anki77
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the hotel selene for 3 nights in Nov 2006. If you arrive at Termini station, take the walk to the hotel. It is only a couple of minutes. You would waste your money taking a taxi. Upon checking in we had to hand over our passports for 30 minutes or so whilst we took our bags up to our room and then came back to reception to collect them. We were a bit sceptical about this as this had not happened at other hotels in europe. However, we were also asked to do the same at our hotel in Venice, so figured it must be italian protocol. I still don't really understand why. We had a room on the 4th floor overlooking the front and we found there was no noise from the street. The room was spacious and spotless. The bathroom was also quite roomy and clean. There was a good choice of food at breakfast. The location was good and perfectly safe. We walked to all the sights, except caught the metro to the Vatican as were unsure of the distance and wanted to get there early to avoid queues. However we walked back to the hotel from the vatican, and the distance was fine (stopping for a gelato or two at campo di fiori and piazza navona - the hazelnut gelato was divine!!!) Overall we had no problems with hotel selene and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price hotel with wholesome breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: cruiserhiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Selene on Via Virminale. It locates very close to Metro station at Piazza della Republica. Comparing this hotel with the same class hotel we had stayed for last two trips, the Pension Nationale on Via Venezia, H. Selene will be my choice from now on. While they served meat spred & chesse spred at othere place, at H. Selene, we have "Real" ham, chesse, eggs & fruit cocktail beside orange juice, yogurt, bread, croissant, roll every morning. The waitresses won't mind that you ask for second coffee or tea. By tipping her an euro/pp or so when she brought them(I have hot tea & cappuccino), it was most appreciated. Not many people tip them. To me, roaming in Rome with full stomach is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, loved it”
Reviews.Author: crazyfornaples
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Italy and stayed 2 nights at the Hotel Selene in Rome. Rita, the manager was wonderful,(spoke English) we got there early, she took our luggage, we walked there from the Rome Termini Station, (couldn't get a taxi) It was only a few blocks, then we walked back and took the "Green Bus" open panoramic tour bus, this was about 3 blocks from the hotel, across from the main bus terminal in front of the Farmacia. No lines here.... 15 euro each, ticket good for 24 hours, makes 13 stops, narrated with head phones 2 hours total if you stay on, which we did the first day, ask Rita about this, it was great, as you can get off and on and see all the attractions, it passes each stop every hour. When we returned to the hotel our luggage was in our room, very clean room, quite large, large bathroom with shower and central a/c and heat, and very quiet, great value 138 euro, very nice breakfast, buffet style. Hotel gives 10% discount at a restaurant "La Cuzina Nazionale", great food and street where it is located (2 blocks from hotel) Via Nazionale was very safe to walk at night, tons of shops and cafes. Would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: KillBill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for only one night. It's location was great being so close to Termini station, which is handy for leaving Rome (express train to the airport) and for getting around Rome (metro lines A &B). The rooms were clean and comfortable and great value for Rome. The breakfast was simple, but that's Italy. Coffee was made for you, which was a nice change from the coffee machines or filter coffee which we had experienced in a few other Italian hotels. The best thing I have to say about our stay was the lack of noise. My friend and I had been travelling for 2 weeks and this was the best night sleep we had. Also, the hotel staff were nice. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again due to its price, location and quiet rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Selene From a Family's Perspective”
Reviews.Author: rbsilver
Reviews.Content: After reading all the mixed reviews of the Hotel Selene we were skeptical about booking a room there. However, as a family of 5 we needed an inexpensive hotel, centrally located, safe, and clean place to stay during 4 days in Rome. We took a chance on the Selene. Budget wise it matched and it was certainly easily to navigate all over Rome from the Termini which is located an easy 2 blocks from the hotel. The neighborhood is safe; however, a few blocks in either direction and it becomes seedy - FAST. If you've ever travelled to San Francisco you will find yourself feeling much like you are in the Tenderloin. You definately won't feel like you are in luxuious digs when you enter the dirty lobby with worn carpet. A reception receptacle is located next door with two, helpful, but not overly friendly staff. A small elevator (accommodates 2 adults and a few suitcases) can take you to the third floor to the actual hotel entrance. Once inside the doors, the hotel tries to exude an air of Euro-Chic, but fails. Very hard beds, flat pillows, and no basic amenities like soap await you. Nothing like travelling for 24 hours to be greeted by dingy surroundings, a bed like a stone, not even one feather pillow - while not a princess I do enjoy being comfortable in bed when I travel. We expected that soap would be provided and I guess if you can call the detergen in the dispenser in the shower and next to the sink soap, we had it! Breakfast was definately a weakness. While definately a European experience, my children who have wide and varied palettes were pretty much disgusted by the experience. Thank God for coffee and croissants! Since we truly wanted a hotel that was just for sleeping the Hotel Selene worked out fine. There wasn't anything terrible about the hotel, but there certainly wasn't anything great about it either. When I return to Rome I would definately find a different Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Selene, Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ryanair-Jetsetters
Reviews.Content: The mixture of reviews made us a little wary of what to expect from this hotel. When we got there this was quicky put to rest. The hotel was very close to the main train station and was very easy to find. Despite getting there in the early hours of the morning the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a building with two other hotels and the Selene is over the third and forth floors. The lift is old and small but works fine. The room was very clean and comfortable, had a good size bathroom, a fridge and a safe. Nothing fancy but good value for what you pay. After all, you wont spend much time in the room, there is far too much to see in Rome. If you are looking for a big lobby and chocolates on your bed every morning, stay elsewhere. If you want clean and comfy this is for you. The area around the hotel is safe to walk round at night and all tourist spots are in walking distance, but if you are looknig for a guided tour bus the station is only round the corner and the buses take you to all areas of beauty. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: lightin80
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews we were a little unsure of what to expect but when we got there things were great. The staff was very helpful. We loved the location since it was just down the street from termini which made it easy to get to from the airport, and easy to travel to all parts of the city. The room was clean and comfortable, breakfast really good for Italy and the bathroom as good as many in the US. The building contains three hotels and this one is on the third and fourth floor. The lift is small and not modern but what do you expect for one that was installed in an existing building (remember Rome is not a new city). As far a value everything is relative (what do you think a good value on gasoline is today compared to two years ago?). We booked pretty late and were quite satified relitive to other hotels in the area. The in-room safe was wonderful and big enough to fit a laptop computer. If you are looking for a hotel with a big lobby and alot of amendities, staty elsewhere. If you are looking for a clean comfortable place to stay, in and area that is safe to walk at night close to public transportation, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendywooaz
Reviews.Content: I didn't have any real problems with this hotel, but it didn't really knock my socks off either. Other than being close to the train station, the location isn't really ideal. Most sights will involve a metro ride unless you are gung-ho about hoofing it. Fortunately the metro is only one block away. The positives were: the rooms are VERY quiet, they have reinforced their windows and padded their walls. The breakfast was good. The bathrooms are really nice. The air conditioning worked extremely well. And the front desk gives you an excellent map of the city that includes the location of the hotel. The negatives were: the hotel is on third floor of a building, which initially feels a little weird. The lift is a little sketchy too - small and old. The location of hotel isn't great. The beds aren't as nice as they look on the website, but they're still ok. And finally, there is currently scaffolding outside of the hotel so you can't open the shudders to get any light in the room. This is as of June '05 so you could ask if it's gone when you book. Overall, if I had gotten a better deal on this hotel, say 90 euros in June, I might stay here again. But we paid 120 (for 2 people) and I don't feel it was worth that much.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Exceeded”
Reviews.Author: Headhunter1951
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews about the Selene we arrived with a little trepidation. Our fears were unfounded, the room was ready and spotless. over the 5 days we stayed the housekeeping was excellent. Staff from the small reception to the porter/breakfast cook were polite and helpful. Breakfast was good and plentiful . Great place to use as a base as the lounge facilities are limited. I think a lot of redecoration and refurbishment has taken place over the last year, Great location for the metro and bus station. Fantastic restaurant called the Giggolo opposite the opera.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with Cork man”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree wholeheartedly with the reviewer from Cork - but there was no evidence of buiding work or the advertised lounge/bar when we stayed between 17-20 July 2004. Certainly not a place to linger in, although thankfully so much to see & do in Rome. Helpful reception staff (as advertised)? - must have been on holiday when we stayed. In fairness, the rooms are spacious & comfortable, if gloomy. Air conditioning works well - unlike the lift. Good location, but won't be staying there again. Little choice at breakfast - and please - ditch the powdered 'fresh' orange juice!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by Selene”
Reviews.Author: Mallo
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not live up to its website description. There was no proper reception area, loung3e or reading area or proper bar. All of these things were advertised. There were workmen hard at work on these areas but they will not be ready for another month. Under the circumstances I thought €100 for a single room most unfair especially as a double room was €120. When I asked for a discount I was told there was no such possibility. In fairness the bedrooms were well appointed, spacious and comfortable but there was no atmosphere and no one you could talk to about Rome. Most disappointing. I hope the owners read this as I intend contacting them anyway. I will not return - nor will my friends.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Selene Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Viminale, 8, 00184 Rome, Italy
